name: OS X Application and System Extension File

description: APPEX (short for app extension) files allow developers to extend the custom functionality and content beyond their app. App extensions also make the content from a developer's app available to users while they are utilizing the system or other apps. Since Apple applies limitations to the memory usage of apps, extensions are utilized to launch separately from the app to provide functionality then quit in order to save on memory use. App extensions are opened when a user selects it in a host app, which then issues a request to the extension, which receives it, assists the user in performing the task, then promptly closes after completing or cancelling the request.
